alert.note: Alert for Erath (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 13 at 1:28AM CDT until May 13 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Texas, including the following counties, Erath and Hood. * WHEN...Until 430 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Stephenville, Granbury, Dublin, Pecan Plantation, Lipan, Morgan Mill, Bluff Dale, Huckabay, Oak Trail Shores, Squaw Creek Reservoir, DeCordova, Cresson, Tolar, Stockton Bend, Waples, Mambrino, Purves, Paluxy, Harbin and Selden.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
